website_summaries.verdict: The Linksys Smart Wi-Fi Router AC 1900 (WRT1900AC) delivers excellent throughput with current-gen wireless clients, and promises killer speeds for future devices. In the meantime, upcoming OpenWRT flashable firmware, wonderful QoS, easy setup, and powerful NAS functionality, for a hefty price
pros: Unprecedented throughput speed when testing with second router as a bridge
Easy setup, remote access, and management
QoS feature cuts down time to buffer a video

customer_reviews.title: overpriced with some flaws
customer_reviews.text: It works fine in Pcs ecosistema, but when you mix it with Apple airports the nightmare begins. Also some features have to be set up with the linksys app that is not user friendly at all, and is almost impossible to deal with if you only have macOs. Nevertheless It has a decent range, is stable enough, both frecuencies 2,4 and 5ghz works just fine, also the Guest networks. But in a price/value ratio, I believe its overpriced
customer_reviews.author: uberto battaggia

customer_reviews.title: Really GREAT product, fast
customer_reviews.text: Really GREAT product, fast, easy to config, strong and powerful. I bought it with some low expectation because I saw a strong marketing work, but really what marketing people promote, is what you will receive. No freeze of video streaming, even my bandwith is just 6 Mbits, but Netflix & Youtube, as well as internal storage (NAS Cloud) video streaming works so nice, no delay.
customer_reviews.author: Sigfridov

customer_reviews.title: Great Router
customer_reviews.text: My IP wanted to charge me to upgrade their router to AC so I just bought this instead. I have two of these and have no issues with them at all. I really like the remote access via App option.
customer_reviews.author: Vernon D.

customer_reviews.title: Router for home
customer_reviews.text: Seller shipped item extremely fast. The router is very user friendly to set up and connect. However for the price, I haven't been impressed with performance.
customer_reviews.author: Leighanne Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Router
customer_reviews.text: This router is about as easy to use and set up as any new router, but excels because of its near infinite range. You need a network password, or else your neighbors will have access.
customer_reviews.author: Austin

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Had to be restarted every 3 days, not worth buying
customer_reviews.author: Buddj

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny.
customer_reviews.text: When I watched reviews on this router, everyone seemed to love it. Now I know why! the configuration utilities for the router and everything that goes with it is extremely simple and easy to understand. On top of all that, it still has the stackable parts on it so I can put my others on top from linksys to make it even better. With all the torture i've put this thing through and its still going like a charm without a single issue.
customer_reviews.author: Steve S.

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper to buy it at Linksys Directly or Best Buy.
customer_reviews.text: After doing much research, I wanted to buy the WRT1900AC to replace my DLink which was going on the fritz. The cheapest place I could find to buy it was straight from Linksys Website, which also directed me to Best Buy, if I wanted to pick it up today. So I did. But of course Best Buy had to add taxes, but it was still cheap than any where else on the internet or in stores. We did have to call tech support to get it going though. I do seem to be getting much better reception on the 5 Ghz. ; ) Update: It quit working way to soon.
customer_reviews.author: Tami Geli

customer_reviews.title: Excellant top of the line router
customer_reviews.text: Super fast. Love the storage features. The gui interface is pretty decent, but lacks the ability to change the userid. Also, renaming the router, is not exactly perfect, it stil retains the original factory assigned name within the gui. Also, this may change as other open source firmware is developed. If Open Source firmware is a selling point, then they should be working with open source groups more closely. Check out the forums on DD-WRT, and you will find out more info on what the hold up actually is.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Best of the Best
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I took my time in buying a new router. This is amazing. Best Router i have ever had, This device is fast and stays connected. Nothing lagging or re-config. Anyone who is saying this isn't a good router, please make sure you read their cries and complaints because most of them reviews are from people who just like to complaint about anything. Do your own research. This product is exactly what I've been looking for and some.
customer_reviews.author: Reddy

customer_reviews.title: so good. GREAT signal
customer_reviews.text: so far, so good. GREAT signal, excellent setup, good software, nice hardware... (low profile - as I have it in the closet behind a door). No complaints. While I don't need another (living in a condo)... I would buy this again if it went dead in a "reasonable" amount of technological time. ;)
customer_reviews.author: tc

customer_reviews.title: No Problems
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this router over 4 years now and have not experienced any of the problems that I'm reading here. I have a Desktop. Laptop, iPhone, HP All In One Printer, 7 Smart TV's, INVIDIA SHEILD and 4 Amazon Fire Sticks connected with no lag time or buffering on anything.
customer_reviews.author: ITSMLRTM

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with the WRT1900AC
customer_reviews.text: The router is great, I replaced a Linksys WRT160N V2 with the WRT1900AC and as soon as I installed the router I saw a dramatic increase in speed in IE 11 the pages would load faster not to mention on fire fox or Opera was even faster, in my internal network the shared files and streaming was also faster, I'm very satisfied with the new router not to mention the additional functions it has that my old router did not have, like the guest access point as well as the dual frequency 2.5MHz and 5 MHz and the processor the router has with its cache is great.
customer_reviews.author: Tomas Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Everything it's advertised to be.
customer_reviews.text: Nearly effortless installation! As soon as connections were made, the smartwifi program popped up and I ran through a couple of configuration pages and I was up and running in minutes! Zero problems, zero effort! Highly recommended to those who must have to have the latest, greatest, fastest, etc... Superior range/signal strength in my 3 level home. I upgraded/replaced a Linksys E4200 with this and it's like night and day. Haven't run any speed tests, and have yet to check impact on all my devices but I have no reason to believe that all the results will not be outstanding. Will update my review if I'm proven wrong...
customer_reviews.author: tj

customer_reviews.title: Open Source/OpenWRT lies.
customer_reviews.text: Claiming this router is open source is a bunch of lies. I bought this router for OpenWRT support. I've been been holding out hope that the drivers for the wifi chip would come and all the patches would get integrated upstream. Great work Linksys/Belkin. You really f'd this one up badly.
customer_reviews.author: Zac Bowling

customer_reviews.title: so far, its great!
customer_reviews.text: I just got the art to take advantage of an increase in our cable internet speed, and our old equipment couldn't keep up anymore. This unit replaces a befs router/switch with 8 ports from the 1990's and a wireless range expander for the (back then) requirement of just a few wireless devices. Now, most everything has wireless capabilities and 8 ports were way too much. The setup for the art was incredibly easy... no more configuring IP addresses or resetting the wireless system every day or so. Its pricey, and hopefully the price may come down in the future, but right now, this is the best piece of equipment I've gotten in the last 15 years.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Sasak

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic router - great range - easy to setup
customer_reviews.text: I bought two Routers one as a main router and one as a wireless repeater. Setup was very simple for the main router. The wizard walked me through it step by step. It took me a little more work setting up the second unit as a wireless repeater. The wizard did not provide that option. I wish it would. I found instructions in the Linksys website. I put the main router in the basement with the modem and the repeater in the second floor. Coverage in the house is fantastic, full bars everywhere. I think I would have been OK with only get one router for the entire house. Coverage is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: Gerardo J  Rincon

customer_reviews.title: Pretty awesome but not much different
customer_reviews.text: The interface is interesting with some fun options but overall it needs some more to prove itself as top of the pack. The distance is pretty good but it isn't like a mile or anything and it is pretty big but the mass storage feature works really really well!! Overall pretty glad I bought it, a few of my devices didn't like the mixed WPA/WPA2 personal signal mode so you may have to play with that for your network.
customer_reviews.author: Jaron

customer_reviews.title: spent 2 hours on phone with linksys support
customer_reviews.text: Sending router back on return. My 2nd WRT1900AC. Wireless speeds never reached past 20-22mbps while I was pulling 60mbps wired via ethernet to the router. 80+ mbps straight from the modem. Going to look @ the competition.
customer_reviews.author: Eugene Cox

customer_reviews.title: Easy Install and Great Speed
customer_reviews.text: PROS: The install was simple and the router has greatly improved the coverage in my two story home. All seven devices in my home now have excellent and faster connections and I did not have to tweak the antennas. I am yet to have less that max coverage anywhere in my home. I also like the fact that I did not have to load any software on my primary computer - the install was all web based. CONS: The WRT1900AC has a bigger footprint that my previous router and this may be an issue if you have limited desktop space.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas M. Moss

customer_reviews.title: Awesome - Easy and Fast
customer_reviews.text: Unit replaced an EA6500AC. Simple plug and play. No software needed as the EA6500 was already installed. Faster, Better range and consistent. Had for a month now, very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jones in US

customer_reviews.title: Great Consumer Router.  Full stop.
customer_reviews.text: All the neat features work if you are using it as your router, directly connected to your MODEM. Technical chat said it had SNMP support. It does not. If you use it as a bridge (ie second wifi) you only get to use one of the radios. 2.4 OR 5. Choose wisely. Also, all of the remote monitoring and configuration are gone in bridge mode. $300 dumb radio now. Same if you use it as wireless repeater. One radio, no special features. So if this is going to be your router, DHCP host, and first WIFI in the line, you're good to go. Otherwise, wasting about $200 on this one. Personally, I am returning mine.
customer_reviews.author: George Robertson

customer_reviews.title: Instant and Painless Network server
customer_reviews.text: I noticed that there was an eSata port on the back of the unit. I connected a WD eSata My book to the router and voila! I have a network server that can be read by all my computers and tablets. Range on the 5 band is terrific. I deducted one star because of the price, not the quality of the router.
customer_reviews.author: Advocate

customer_reviews.title: Easily supports 20 devices simultaneously.
customer_reviews.text: Solved all of our wireless issues. Easily supports 7 people online gaming plus 6-8 more devices watching netflix. Ethernet speed directly to modem: 29.8mbps. Wireless AC speed at 20 ft distance: 29.5mbps. Our old router (free Comcast router) gave about 13-15mbps to put that in perspective.
customer_reviews.author: skylarmb

customer_reviews.title: 3 second setup/install and blazing speed
customer_reviews.text: Our history with Linksys routers is to get every latest model, and this is a game changer. I don't know the precise speed measurements; I just know that this is giving all of our devices blazing speed.
customer_reviews.author: B Forney

customer_reviews.title: so far so great
customer_reviews.text: I have had the WRT 1900AC installed for less than a week. I proved easy to install and replace my previous Cisco wireless router. So far I am not having dropped signal and the speed has been good for what I have done so far. Will know more after we have used it more.
customer_reviews.author: Butch Schroyer DVM

customer_reviews.title: RECEIVED A BRAND NEW DEFECTIVE ITEM..
customer_reviews.text: Long story short, this item works GREAT on Ethernet connections AND 5 Ghz signals. On both I get the 12 Meg down as I am paying for. On 2.4 Ghz I am only getting 2.4 Meg. After talking to senior technicians at Linksys and interacting with test results and so forth they said that the router is DEFECTIVE for sure. What a bummer. Just hung up with Best Buy and they are sending another one. ONLY bought from Best Buy due to their price being significantly lower than my favorite, Amazon. Otherwise, if I had not had this failure I would have given it five stars for sure. It runs COOL and it is built like a tank.
customer_reviews.author: Discriminating Buyer in Colorado

customer_reviews.title: 1st Class
customer_reviews.text: This thing is the real deal. It comes packaged like the crown jewels and delivers on the everything it says-- incredible range and speed, ease of set-up, a comprehensive solution to whole-house networking, Worth every penny. My house runs like it should now-- everything connects and runs fast. no lags, no juddering, awesome! For the sake of $50-60 premium price difference vs other options, just get the best solution and be done with it. The single best thing you can do to make your house deliver on the promise of wireless connectivity.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Patton

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Router
customer_reviews.text: The WRT1900AC replaced a Netgear R7000. The Netgear was constantly dropping connections.. I even had it lose connection with my iphone when I was in the same room as it! The Linksys is outstanding, it was easy to setup, coverage is a bit better than the R7000, and speeds seem a bit quicker. Best of all so far no dropouts.. If you're looking for arguably the state of the art in home routers this is it.
customer_reviews.author: Erik M.

customer_reviews.title: Great for end users that are not super tech savy!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought an earlier linksys wireless router and even though I don't have a huge house the back bedroom and the downstairs bedroom kept loosing connectivity. This one was very easy to set up. gave clear instructions on how to set it up. all rooms of the house have no issues with wifi now. wifi TV in back room and downstairs stay connected all the time. Not to mention the speed of connection for TV's and all computers and tech!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Blows through walls, fast, great coverage
customer_reviews.text: I've tried 5 different routers at my house (2700 sq. ft.) and they have all had dead spots. Got this guy and coverage is amazing and very fast speeds. Works from my upstairs corner of my house all the way into the basement opposite corner with full wifi bars on my phone! Expensive, but worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Southworth

customer_reviews.title: Generally an excellent router
customer_reviews.text: An excellent router which offers significantly greater signal strength in the distant parts of my home. I've owned two prior Linksys models and this one is the best thus far. Quick and easy to install. The only quirk I've never figured out is why this and my prior Linksys routers all seem to slow down over time. Reboot it and it flies. But several days later a speed test reveals that it's significantly slower (I mean REALLY slower) than before. Reboot it, and it's instantly back to normal again. If this didn't seem to be endemic of all Linksys routers, I'd give it five stars.
customer_reviews.author: Jon L.

customer_reviews.title: Great consumer router
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a router with more range and speed after my previous router failed. I bought a Linksys N750 but was very disappointing with the range. The WRT1900AC has all the range I need and it is blazing fast. Well built.
customer_reviews.author: George Wallace

customer_reviews.title: Better than the last one
customer_reviews.text: This has been a world better than the EA6900 we had before. The range seems to be better and it actually stays connected most of the time. It has dropped connection a few times, but overall the performance has been good. Had trouble with the Smart Wifi server not connecting, but that seems to have been taken care of and now works.
customer_reviews.author: ScoDog

customer_reviews.title: Best wireless coverage of any router, but firmware is lacking features
customer_reviews.text: The router is fast, the GUI is pretty good, and hopefully will get more features as, the iPhone app is just ok. Running multiple XBOXs over wireless is not possible. Would have received 5 starts except that there is still no OpenWRT support even though it is advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Carolina Cowboys

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: The install was fast. Didn't need any cables Good speed. My provider gives me 118MBs on the modem. I Use simultaneously 2 Roku boxes, 1 laptop, 1 Wi-Fi TV and I got into my Wi-Fi network around 78MBs, previously I was not able to get more then 50MBs.
customer_reviews.author: Aurelian Constantinescu

customer_reviews.title: Blazingly fast.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time my entire home has had consistent strong signal and fast wireless connectivity. Simply amazing speed. I am still kicking myself for not buying this sooner. Expensive, but worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: David H Oermann

customer_reviews.title: Great Range
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure about all the high tech features but I wanted more range and it's exactly what I got. Probably double over what I was getting with the E4200. I've only had it a few days and it was a breeze to set up. Haven't done much playing with it and not sure how the antennas are supposed to be aligned but I'll figure all that out later. for now I'm very happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: pdgear

customer_reviews.title: BEST ROUTER YET
customer_reviews.text: I had two prior Linksys routers and this is the best one yet. Very easy to set up and since I already had a Linksys wi-fi account, all my previous account details were merely updated. I am very impressed by the faster speeds with this router and it's signal thrength throughout my two story house. Worth every penny to upgrade!
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Gantner

customer_reviews.title: Blazing!
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded from an earlier generation Airport Extreme. My 2.4 GHZ speed went from 24 Mbps to about 50 Mbps and on the 5 GHZ I get 60 and once clocked 105! I am supposed to be getting 50. This is on my iMac which is on another floor than the router. Pretty impressive.
customer_reviews.author: Sunil John

customer_reviews.title: Misleading advertising - No OpenWRT Support
customer_reviews.text: They haven't held up their promise of supporting OpenWRT despite all the hype over it. The OEM firmware is useless and tried to force me to setup an account on their web site to have the router configured by them externally!?!? Absolutely insane. No thanks.
customer_reviews.author: Ngaere

customer_reviews.title: Linksys obviously doesn't understand what made the WRT54GL so popular
customer_reviews.text: The WRT54GL was never about ground breaking performance and features. The WRT54GL was about good performance, solid reliability, LOW PRICE and OPEN SOURCE FIRMWARE SUPPORT. Tomato, DDWRT, and many other open source firmware options made the WRT54GL so compelling, at right around $100. This $300 monstrosity is NOT the spiritual successor to the WRT54GL.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher R.

customer_reviews.title: Very Limited Range - Disappointing For The Money
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, I don't know how this ridiculously expensive thing can be rated so highly. It's limited range for our very small home's a huge disappointment. You have to be nearly right next to it to get the faster performance. I wouldn't waste my money again. I can't return it now (15 days time limit - NOT on Amazon though). Save yourself the grief and the money and just buy a $50 router. It'll perform just as well, I'm sure of that.
customer_reviews.author: cashthedog

customer_reviews.title: Fast Sppeds & Easy Setup
customer_reviews.text: Started on Time Warner Cable w/ the old Linksys WRT54gs and had downloads of 20 mps. Got the new WRT1900ac up and running and speeds jumped to 54 mps. Have 4 times the range wireless with twice the signal. Easy setup. Great Job Linksys !
customer_reviews.author: Kirk

customer_reviews.title: Linksys WRT1900AC Wireless AC Dual Band Router AC1900 PreOrder (Latest... Linksys
customer_reviews.text: I have been wanting a new router for a while now, and I always try to buy the best that I can afford at the time to get the best at the time and make it last as long as I can. = I don't upgrade very often! That being said, this (so far) has been a very good purchase. The Linksys WRT1900AC Wireless AC Dual Band Router AC1900 came very well packaged with very simple instructions for setup. It was a breeze to set up and connect everything I needed. I would HIGHLY recommend this to anyone in need of a new router.
customer_reviews.author: David Duelm

customer_reviews.title: WRT1900
customer_reviews.text: This router is great. I gave it 4 instead of 5 for two reasons. One, the price was kind of sticker shock, but I got over that. Two, the instructions could have been a little clearer, but once it was up and running this thing is a supper star.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Now open source is working fine
customer_reviews.text: If you are going to flash it with LEDE and use it is a good one. IPv6, IPV4 virtualization and TimeMachine are supported, if you are OK to spend few weekends to configure them. If you want out of the box experience, look elsewhere. (Asus is a good option)
customer_reviews.author: S. Iyer

customer_reviews.title: Complete misdirection
customer_reviews.text: Almost purchased this believing this was open source. So disappointed but should be expected with belkin trash anyway. Would consider purchasing this otherwise but knowing about the state of the firmware I'd rather buy Cisco if I was buying black box.
customer_reviews.author: Jena

customer_reviews.title: Just ok,,,?
customer_reviews.text: Not sure of all the tech-talk stuff,,,,switchs,,open wrts ,,base-firmware,,,all equals this to me,,, My sons XBOX 360 keeps laggin and crashing with WiFi problems ,,runs ok thru the new toshiba laptop hard wired to ethernet connection,,My other sons XBOX One seems to be just fine ,,,My two Lap tops are experiencing some slowing issues between servers and e-mail mostly ,,some downloads are screwy ..We only paid $59 bucks for the last router and had just about the same issues . No WiFi drops and lagging in the XBOX 360 games though.SO Just OK<,,My Wallet is Laggin,,,,,,,
customer_reviews.author: H.G.Estes

customer_reviews.title: Linksys 1800
customer_reviews.text: I love it ..........works great and easy install ! I would recommend it to a friend. and the price was right. Thanks, Mike
customer_reviews.author: okjob104

customer_reviews.title: Great feature Set
customer_reviews.text: Even though the WRT1900AC has not third party support as yet, Rome was not built in a day. The unit is fast and has a very good feature set. though somewhat pricey my guess is the price of this unit will lower in time and would be a great upgrade to anyone looking 1900AC feature/speed. I ahve at present 17 Devices listed in the network map. the online Linksys Smart Wifi Website allows you to change the vast majority of settings anywhere in the world to you router. Personally I think this a great upgrade for anyone running 54g/n and look out for fuure deals on the product.
customer_reviews.author: Cybex

customer_reviews.title: FASTEST I've ever seen....With a
customer_reviews.text: Simple USB 3.0 Adapter , I'm @ 1234MBps ! >>>>>>>>>CRAZY FAST ! AS for : Linksys WRT1900AC Wireless AC Dual Band Router AC1900 PreOrder (Latest Model) by Linksys. Pre Order ??? BBUYZ GOT IT NOW @ $250.OO /\ up !
customer_reviews.author: D. Thompson

product_meta.title: Linksys WRT1900AC Wireless AC Dual Band Router
product_meta.description: Garantie L'étroite collaboration entre High-Tech Place et ses fournisseurs nous permet de vous proposer une garantie commerciale de 1 an.
feature_bullets: Four High-Performance Antennas for Maximum Coverge and Reliability
Fastest 1.2 GHz Dual-Core ARM Processor to Surf, Stream and Game Simultaneously
4 x Gigabit Lan Ports, eSATA and USB 3.0 Ports for Sharing of Storage Devices
Media Server DLNA and Open Source - Easily Share Photos, Videos and Music - Buy 2 and use the second as super fast range extender, bridge/adapter or access point

specifications.Customer Reviews: 2.8 out of 5 stars268 ratings2.8 out of 5 stars
